The Borneo side of Malaysia is more than jungle, hikes, and sustainable enterprises. Away from it all, its coastline is scattered with secret bays and the unimaginable for that overdose of the tropics. Sabah reigns somewhat supreme here. 𝗦𝗹𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗿𝗮𝘃𝗲𝗹 from Kota Kinabalu via the unparalleled landscape of the Danum Valley and ending at Semporna; seeing this scene awaiting your arrival should be ample enough to stimulate the senses and make Malaysia a top contender for a total Asian experience. Too many may not be aware of what goes below the kaleidoscope of LED lights and culturally enthralling insights in the Japanese capital. Yet, it is part of our educational endeavours under the so-called STEM principles (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics). Tokyo's flood prevention system is a testament to human ingenuity. It is a sophisticated network designed to mitigate the risks of tsunamis and typhoons. This vast underground infrastructure, comprising 50-meter-deep tunnels and storage chambers, is a marvel of engineering. It has been constructed to temporarily accommodate excess rainwater, thereby safeguarding the metropolis from inundation. It's happening below street level and educational from the first vertical step. More STEM ideas needed? https://hubs.ly/Q02JlGc00 #EducationalTravel #JapanTravel #WorldofDifference

The inauguration of the rail service between Bangkok and Vientiane is a significant milestone in the development of Southeast Asia's regional railway infrastructure. This new route provides a direct overland connection between the two capital cities, enhancing connectivity and reducing journey times to approximately 10 hours. The newly constructed railway segment linking Nong Khai, Thailand, to Khamsavath Station in Vientiane, will take approximately 20 minutes. Downtown Vientiane is located a further eight kilometres from the station. https://hubs.ly/Q02JHQDr0 #TrainTravel #WorldofDifference #ConsciousTravel

The Mighty Mekong is an Asian must. From cruise opportunities to watching how life unfolds and carries on for generations to admiring sunrises and sunsets from different vantage points, it’s time to think about Southeast Asia’s longest river differently. Taking a bike tour to explore the islands of the Mekong is an immersive way to see Cambodia, that is still unknown to many. Departing from Phnom Penh, this 20-kilometre leisurely ride allows one to engage with local communities, whose way of life is entirely dependent on the Mekong River. Silk farms, fruit plantations, and lush orchards are eye-openers for those who believe they have seen it all. Hop on and ride: https://hubs.ly/Q02GTG450 #WorldofDifference #ConsciousTravel #BicycleTours
